name: places/ChIJOz2P2ilbwokRiMC59oggnuk
formattedAddress: 20 Morris St, New York, NY 10006, USA
adrFormatAddress: 20 Morris St, New York, NY 10006-2901, USA

originalText.text: Wow!! The customer service here is top notch. Christian, who took care of every one of my needs & concerns was exceptionally helpful throughout my rental process. He made my rental experience easy and fast while letting me choose the car of my comfort. I will definitely be doing my future rentals through this location and especially with Christian. Thank you!!

text.text: Wow!! The customer service here is top notch. Christian, who took care of every one of my needs & concerns was exceptionally helpful throughout my rental process. He made my rental experience easy and fast while letting me choose the car of my comfort. I will definitely be doing my future rentals through this location and especially with Christian. Thank you!!

originalText.text:
Battery Park, NYC location.

**Updating review to 3 star, down from 5 - was hit with a fuelling charge even though a receipt for gas was provided**

Booked a 3 series, got an upgrade to an X5/6 for $17 a day.
Pickup process is strict with damages (scratches and dings smaller than a credit card that National would normally ignore are all accounted for).

360 camera, automatic parallel parking, and heads up display took the stress out of driving in the city.;

originalText.text: I don't leave reviews pretty much ever because I think they can easily be skewered to favorites but I have to admit that the folks at the Battery Park City office where I typically rent vehicles for my Boy Scout Troop trips are just great - courteous and pleasant are all I am generally looking for and  Samara on Friday was both; and I was helped immediately after she had dealt with a pair of self-entitled gray hairs.  And check in yesterday was the friendliest attendant, I think his name was Bionny. Nice job folks.

And check in yesterday was the friendliest attendant, I think his name was Bionny. Nice job folks.

originalText.text: Rented a car at West Palm Airport and was overwhelmed by how clean, efficient and friendly SIXT was.  The shuttles were spotless and virtually brand new, running often so no wait times at all.  Received our car quickly with pre-check in, and our car had less than 5,000 miles on it.  The car was also spotless and we really enjoyed the whole experience.  The price was also very good for the week.  When returning the car, "THE Sam" greeted us with a smile and got us on our way quickly on the shuttle back to the terminals.  Overall a fantastic experience!

When returning the car, "THE Sam" greeted us with a smile and got us on our way quickly on the shuttle back to the terminals.  Overall a fantastic experience!

originalText.text:
my worst Sixt Experience, ever. At the pickup the agent refused to put on her glasses to read what I intended to show her on my phone (my Sixt Platinum Status). At return, another agent told me to drive around the building to enter the garage. However around the building meant that I was directed to a tunnel and lost almost one hour to get back to the station. At return, of course also gas was consumed at what was full in first place, was 7/8 full when I finally made it there. The third agent told me that signage to the rental return was clearly visible (see photo attached, can you find the signage???) but she understands my situation (I showed her the gas receipt as proof) and she would not charge the gas. Well, of course I got charged the gas ($ 39!!). Instead of acting professionally, she bragged about Sixt being not "just a normal rental car company" but something better than the others. Stations like this should not operate under the otherwise very reliable Sixt brand.

UPDATE: Sixt responded instantly, reviewed the case and acted. That is why I love Sixt. However, I will still avoid this station in the future.
